contentrichtext.text: {{refimprove|date=December 2010}} '''Scipion Abeille''' (died 9 December 1697) was a French [[surgeon]] and [[poet]]. Abeille was born at [[Riez]], [[Alpes-de-Haute-Provence]], and was the brother of [[Gaspard Abeille]]. His most famous work was ''Histoire des Os'' ("Description of the Bones") which was published in 1685. He also wrote ''Le parfait chirurgien d'armée, le traité des playes d'arquebusade, le chapitre singulier tiré de Guidon, l'anatomie de la teste'', Paris, 1696. ==External links== *[http://books.google.co.uk/books?id=jlQ_AAAAcAAJ&pg=PA274&lpg=PA274&dq=scipion+abeille+born&source=bl&ots=SiIvbrQ45C&sig=ZXYkvKP9bPauNBbdUij7yS_-APs&hl=en&ei=Vr-DTLXoIdWJ4QbK3ZiZBQ&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=4&ved=0CCEQ6AEwAw#v=onepage&q&f=false Dictionnaire géographique ... des Gaules ...] {{Authority control|VIAF=42238284}} {{Persondata | NAME = Abeille, Scipion | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Surgeon, poet | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 9 December 1697 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Abeille, Scipion}} [[Category:Year of birth missing]] [[Category:1697 deaths]] [[Category:17th-century French physicians]] [[Category:French poets]] {{France-scientist-stub}}
